results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.

results.title: Flame within
results.brief_description: A silent film consisting of a montage of images of family, friends, childhood and home juxtaposed to the words passion, freedom and home - each word with its meaning defined in text.

results.title: TV subtitles
results.brief_description: Angry and frustrated when a hotel did not provide tv’s with tv suibtitles, Robert took matters into his own hands to fight for the rights of people with special needs. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Signs of understanding
results.brief_description: Kris Chapman talks about the ACMI/Vicdeaf Project, its purpose and of the six deaf/hearing impaired people chosen to take part and contribute their stories and thoughts. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.brief_description: A moving story of how one man’s life was completely turned inside out when he suffered a stroke resulting in a loss of hearing. With subtitles.

results.title: My journey to strength
results.brief_description: Hilda suffers from deafness and here she gives a frank account of the ups and downs in her life and the traumatic effect of losing her mum just before she turned 18. Through support and determination she has survived years of depression and finally found happiness and acceptance. With subtitles.

results.title: The Coolangatta Gold
results.creator_credit: Michael Edgley International, Hoyts, John Weiley and Igor Auzins
results.brief_description: A young son is filled with burning resentment at being forced to live in his brother’s shadow. His brother is burdened by their father’s desire for glory. Their father is obsessed by the need to redeem his own failure twenty years before. A dramatic story of family conflict which culminates in the spectacular excitement of the greatest beach and surf triaquathon in the world, the Coolangatta Gold. Both brothers enter the race, one to win for his father, one bent to beat his father. To do so, they must also compete against each other. Cast: Joss McWilliam, Nick Tate, Robyn Nevin, Josephine Smulders, Colin Friels.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: [The funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey]
results.brief_description:
This film contains documentary footage of the state funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey, which took place on 30 May, 1951 in Melbourne, Victoria.

The film captures the funeral cortege as it proceeds along Swanston Street, with crowds of people lining the streets and buildings. The flag-covered casket is accompanied by a military band, soldiers and dignitaries. Significant public figures marching in the cortege include Prime Minister Robert Menzies, Governor-General William McKell, Governor of Victoria Sir Dallas Brooks and Chief Justice of the High Court Sir John Latham.

The film includes wonderful footage of Swanston Street from a high vantage point with the Shrine of Remembrance in the distance. There are also great shots of soldiers marching together, military horses, people gathered in front of the Melbourne City Baths and a couple watching on atop the facade of the ‘W.H. Terry Memorial Hall’.

An estimated 300,000 people turned out to watch the funeral procession, which travelled from the Shrine of Remembrance, along St Kilda Road, and up Swanston Street to College Crescent, before proceeding by car to Fawkner Crematorium.

Sir Thomas Blamey (24 Jan 1884 – 27 May 1951) was a General in the Australian army and the only Australian to have achieved the rank of Field Marshal.

results.title: Emotions of everyday living: the steps of age
results.creator_credit: Ben Maddow, Helen Levitt and Film Documents
results.brief_description: A discussion of the problems confronting old age. The effect of inactivity on the lives of a crane-driver and his wife after his retirement are shown.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
